function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Cybersecurity, privacy, and ethics concerns related to digital contact tracing apps for COVID-19.","Impact":"Potential exposure of sensitive personal information and violation of privacy rights.","Mitigation":"Implement robust encryption and data protection measures, and adhere to strict privacy regulations and ethical guidelines.","Technologies":"Blockchain technology, encryption algorithms, data anonymization techniques.","People":"Users of the contact tracing apps, individuals whose data is collected.","Owner":"Health authorities, app developers, regulatory bodies."},{"Description":"Potential misuse of published contact information of infected patients, leading to tracking and identification of patient locations.","Impact":"Violation of privacy rights, increased risk of targeted harassment or discrimination.","Mitigation":"Use unique user-ID for each individual through blockchain technology, employ random time-varying tokens as temporary IDs, and adhere to strict privacy regulations.","Technologies":"Blockchain technology, data anonymization techniques, random token generation.","People":"Infected patients, individuals whose contact information is published.","Owner":"Health authorities, app developers, regulatory bodies."},{"Description":"Inadequate containment and mitigation framework for COVID-19 due to gaps in wastewater surveillance from the source.","Impact":"Difficulty in accurately tracking and containing the spread of COVID-19, potential for outbreaks to go undetected.","Mitigation":"Enhance wastewater surveillance capabilities, improve data collection and analysis methods, and implement real-time monitoring systems.","Technologies":"Advanced sensor technology, data analytics, real-time monitoring systems.","People":"Public health authorities, policymakers, stakeholders in the healthcare system.","Owner":"Public health authorities, government agencies, technology developers."}]}
